content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security and avoiding risks, I would choose the option that provides a more stable income over time. In this case, choosing 'B' results in a slightly higher payoff (40$) if the anonymous player also chooses 'B'. Since the game has 75 rounds, even a small difference can add up significantly. However, since there is no way to know the opponent's strategy, I would still take into account the possibility of them choosing 'R' and adjust my strategy accordingly. In the worst-case scenario (opponent chooses 'R' in every round), I still end up with a payoff of 35$ per round which is better than the minimum payoff of 0$ if I choose 'R' while they choose 'B'. Therefore, my choice would be 'B' {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Given my preference for security and avoiding risks, I would stick to my strategy of choosing 'B'. If I had chosen 'R' in this round, I would have gotten a lower payoff (0$). Since I chose 'B', I received a higher payoff (35$) even though my opponent chose 'R'. In the next round, if my opponent chooses 'R' again, I will still get 35$ while they receive nothing. If they switch to 'B' in the next round, I will earn 40$. Therefore, my choice for the next round would be 'B' {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given that both me and my opponent chose 'B' in the previous round, we each received a payoff of 40$. In the next round, if I stick to my strategy of choosing 'B', there is a possibility that my opponent may switch their strategy to 'R' to take advantage of the higher payoff (35$) they can get by exploiting my strategy. However, if I also switch to 'R' in response to my opponent's potential change in strategy, my payoff would drop to 0$ if they choose 'B'. Therefore, it is more beneficial for me to stick with 'B' and maintain a consistent strategy to avoid being exploited by my opponent. My choice for the next round would be 'B' {B}.
